meanings.definition: The state or quality of being soggy.
meanings.sent1: After the rain, the sogginess of the ground made it difficult to walk.
meanings.sent2: The sogginess of the bread made it unappetizing.
meanings.sent3: The sogginess of the sponge made it a poor choice for a pillow.
meanings.sent4: Her mood matched the sogginess of the weather outside.
meanings.sent5: The sogginess of the towel was a result of leaving it out in the rain.

meanings.definition: The condition of being soaked with liquid.
meanings.sent1: The sogginess of his shoes indicated he had stepped in a puddle.
meanings.sent2: The sogginess of the cereal was due to leaving it in milk for too long.
meanings.sent3: The sogginess of the paper caused it to tear easily.
meanings.sent4: The sogginess of the sponge made it perfect for cleaning up spills.
meanings.sent5: The sogginess of the cloth was a result of it being left out in the rain.
